did.unittitle: The Memory Project Oral History collection | 民间记忆计划口述史
did.abstract: The Memory Project Oral History collection comprises digital video recordings and written supporting documentation of interviews spanning 2009 to 2016. The interviews were conducted by filmmakers associated with the Work Station, a film studio run by Wu Wenguang in Caochangdi, Beijing, China. Memory Project interviews were conducted with Chinese people about mid-20th century rural life, primarily experiences during the Great Famine (1958-1961), but also the Land Reform and Collectivization (1949-1953), the Great Leap Forward (1958-1960), the Four Cleanups Movement (1964), and the Cultural Revolution (1966-1976). Wu's studio in suburban Beijing, known as the Work Station, is the home for this project. More than 150 young filmmakers have joined the project, and since 2010 they have visited 246 villages in 20 provinces and interviewed more than 1,100 elderly villagers. These filmmakers, many of whom returned to their families' rural hometowns, developed new intergenerational relationships with elderly relatives. During the process of interviewing the villagers, they reconciled the official history taught in schools with each family's experiences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Memory Project Oral History collection comprises digital video recordings and written supporting documentation of interviews spanning 2009 to 2016. The interviews were conducted by filmmakers associated with the Work Station, a film studio run by Wu Wenguang in Caochangdi, Beijing, China. Memory Project interviews were conducted with Chinese people about mid-20th century rural life, primarily experiences during the Great Famine (1958-1961), but also the Land Reform and Collectivization (1949-1953), the Great Leap Forward (1958-1960), the Four Cleanups Movement (1964), and the Cultural Revolution (1966-1976). The interviews show regional variations in famine experiences and rural culture. They add intimate detail and humanity to the story of the deaths and starvation of millions of Chinese, providing a unique perspective on the unofficial history of the Great Famine.

Due to the geographic scope and rural focus of the Memory Project, the interviews are frequently conducted in regional dialects. In many cases, the filmmakers provided Chinese language transcripts. Many recordings are also accompanied by prose reflections written by the filmmakers, the text of which originally came from the Work Station blog or email communication between filmmakers. The notes and blogs written by the filmmakers and the interview footage preserve the fading memories of people who lived through the Great Famine, ensuring that their stories are not forgotten.

The interviews described in this collection guide are arranged geographically by Province and Village. While multiple filmmakers may have worked in a single province, in most cases, only a single filmmaker traveled to each village represented. Approximately 500, nearly one half, of the interviews and supporting documentation are described as of January 2021. These interviews include those conducted by Wu Wenguang 吴文光, Zhang Mengqi 章梦奇, Zou Xueping 邹雪平, Li Xinmin 李新民, Jia Nannan 贾楠楠, Luo Bing 罗兵, Lin Tao 林涛, Zhang Ping 张苹, Li Yushan 李雨珊, Guo Zhihua 郭志华, Qu Yufeng 屈玉凤, Gao Runxiang 高润香, Guo Rui 郭睿, Hu Tao 胡涛, Jia Zhitan 贾之坦, Shao Yuzhen 邵玉珍, Shu Qiao 舒侨, Wen Hui 文慧, Wu Haizhu 吴海珠, Ye Zuyi 叶祖艺, Yi Yangmin 易旸敏, and Zhang Haishen 张海深. Other interviews will be published incrementally as each filmmaker's material is arranged and described.

Most materials are available in Chinese. A smaller number of interview transcripts have been translated into English. Those interviews that have English translations are noted in the individual interview descriptions below. All digital files are available online. Videos may be played directly through this collection guide while additional text documents and transcripts can be accessed clicking links next to the embedded videos in this collection guide, or directly via Duke Digital Collections at https://repository.duke.edu/dc/memoryproject/.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In 2010, documentary filmmaker Wu Wenguang launched the Memory Project to collect oral histories from survivors of the Great Famine that devastated rural China between 1958 and 1961. Officially known in China as the "Three Years of Natural Disasters" or "The Difficult Three-Year Period," the Great Famine caused the death of between 20 and 43 million people. More recently the project has also covered the Great Leap Forward of 1958-1960, the Land Reform and the Collectivization of 1949-1953, the Four Cleanups Movement in 1964, and the Cultural Revolution of 1966-1976.

Wu's studio in suburban Beijing, known as the Work Station, is the home for this project. More than 150 young filmmakers have joined the project, and since 2010 they have visited 246 villages in 20 provinces and interviewed more than 1,100 elderly villagers. These filmmakers, many of whom returned to their families' rural hometowns, developed new intergenerational relationships with elderly relatives. During the process of interviewing the villagers, they reconciled the official history taught in schools with each family's experiences.

Wu Wenguang was born in 1956 in Yunnan Province, China, as is considered a founding figure in Chinese independent documentary films. His other work includes Bumming in Beijing: the Last Dreamers (1990), 1966: My Time in the Red Guards (1993), At Home in the World (1995), Jiang Hu: Life on the Road (1999), Dance with Farm Workers (2002), Fuck Cinema (2005), Treating (2010), Bare Your Stuff (2010), Investigating My Father (2016), and Gao Bo between Beijing-Paris (2019).

did.unittitle: Gaogezhuang Village | 顺义区杨镇高各庄

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gaogezhuang Village is located in Shunyi District, Beijing. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Shao Yuzhen.
高各庄位于北京市顺义区杨镇。村民的录像采访人是邵玉珍。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wu Shiqi (b. 1933) is a resident of Gaogezhuang Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, Wu talks about his experience during the Great Famine. Wu was driving cart for the production team in Xiaodian Village, so he did not starve at all. However, because the production team in his village needed to build a kindergarten, the east side of his house had to be demolished.
吴士奇1933年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇高各庄村民。在这段口述中，吴老人回忆了大饥荒时期吃食堂的经历。当时吴老人在小店为生产队赶车，所以没有挨饿，但因为村里要建幼儿园，吴老人家东边的房子都给拆了。

did.unittitle: Shaziying Village | 顺义区杨镇沙子营

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Shaziying Village is located in Shunyi District, Beijing. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Shao Yuzhen.
沙子营村位于北京市顺义区杨镇。村民的录像采访人是邵玉珍。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gao Yueqi (b. 1928) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. Gao joined the communist army during the Civil War. After being demobilized, he was assigned to work on finalizing the Land Reform. In this interview, Gao describes various policies during the Land Reform and how to calculate the exploitation rate for the purpose of class identification. Meanwhile, Gao points out that there were lots of physical conflicts during the Land Reform and many people were beaten to death. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
高悦启1928年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村村民，解放战争时期入伍参军，复员转业后参与土改的收尾工作。在这段口述中高老人讲述了当年土改的各项政策，如何靠计算剥削率来划定成分。据高老人回忆，土改期间打人情况严重，有些村打死不少人。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lu Jiwen (b. 1945) moved to Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing in 1961 when his parents who were intellectuals but received mistreatment were sent to the countryside for reeducation. In this interview, Lu talks about the life before and after Cultural Revolution. Because most of the work points they earned by working at the production team were used to treat his mom's heart disease, they led a very poor life. His dad passed away when the Four Cleanups Movement just started and his reputation was not rehabilitated until when Cultural Revolution ended. When his mom passed away in 1966 and his four elder sisters all left home because of work or school, he and his younger brother were the only ones left at home and had to support themselves by working at the production team. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
卢记文1945年出生，1961年随父母下放到北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营劳动。在这段口述中，卢老人回忆了文革前后的生活。因为卢老人的母亲有心脏病，家里在生产队工作挣的工分都给她用来看病，所剩无几。63年大四清刚开始的时候卢老人的父亲就去世了，他的名誉一直到文革结束以后才得以恢复。66年卢老人的母亲也去世了，四个姐姐因为读书和工作的关系也已离家，家里就剩下卢老人和弟弟靠务农劳作相依为命。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Yin Lianrong (b. 1941) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, Yin recalls the life during and after the Great Famine. Once a pig of the Production Team in Gaogezhuang Village died, so the man who fed the livestock cooked the pig. His son ate most of the pig and was eventually stuffed to death. Because of the edible things her dad found near the reed field, Yin's family did not starve badly. When one of her kids was born, due to malnutrition, Yin did not have milk. She had to buy a goat for 5 Yuan and fed the baby with goat milk. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
尹连荣1941年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村民。在这段口述中，尹老人回忆了大饥荒时期及之后的生活。当时高各庄有人给生产队喂牲口，死了一头猪便煮来吃，他儿子抢着吃猪肉，结果撑死了。尹老人一家靠她爸爸在苇子地周围开荒捡吃的才不至于挨饿。尹老人结婚生了孩子后，因为营养不良没有奶水，只能花5块钱买了头羊，给孩子喂羊奶喝。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zhang Zeying (b. 1943) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. His early life was quite difficult as his family was identified as landlords, his mother passed away when he was very young and his father was identified as a rightist during the Anti-Rightist Movement. In this interview, Zhang recalled the life from the Great Leap Forward to the Great Famine when clothes and food were very scarce. Everyone was assigned 17-jin grains per month and eating on the Production Team's canteen. However, because a large amount of the assigned portion was also for the 10 cooks working at the canteen, the foods were far from enough. Only catres had enough to eat because they either extorted or stole from the public properties. In 1958 there was a big harvest, so a large amount of grain were wasted. However, starting from 1959 when the harvest was not good and the stored sweet potatoes went bad because of low temperature, people started to starve. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
张泽英1943年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村村民，家庭出身是地主，早年母亲去世，父亲也在反右期间被划为右派。在这段口述中，张老人回忆了大跃进至大饥荒时期缺衣少食的生活。当时吃食堂，一人一个月分配17斤粮食，其中不少还要供给队里十个大厨，根本吃不饱。只有干部或偷或搜刮公家财产才不至于挨饿。58年粮食大丰收，大家吃饱饭就浪费粮食。59年开始粮食减产，存的白薯也冻坏了，挨饿的日子便开始了。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zhao Guifang (b. 1926) was married into Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing when she was 20. In this interview, Zhao talks about her hardship during the Great Famine. Originally Zhao had five daughters and one son, but because the famine was worse in Hebei Province, Zhao's dad asked her to take one of her sister's daughters. Life did not improve until when the kids grew a little older so that Zhao could lead them to make mats for extra money while Zhao's husband went to work in the city.
赵桂芳1926年出生，20岁嫁到了北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营。在这段口述中，赵老人回顾了大饥荒时期的生活。赵老人原来有五个女儿，一个儿子，大饥荒时期因为河北省的情况更严重，赵老人的爸爸便把她姐姐的一个女儿过继给了她。后来孩子大了些，赵老人就带着他们织席，再加上赵老人的丈夫在外头打工赚钱，生活得以有所改善。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ma Shuying (b. 1927) was married into Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing when she was 17. In this interview, Ma recalls the life during the Great Famine. During that time when Ma's husband went to build the Miyun Reservoir, she had to take care of six children all by herself. However, she still had to work at the production team otherwise they could not eat at the communal canteen. Later Ma led the children to make mats and hats for extra money. They were even disrespected by some neighbors because of their poverty.
马淑英1927年出生，17岁嫁到了北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营。在这段口述中，马老人回忆了大饥荒时期吃食堂的经历。当时马老人的丈夫上密云修水库，马老人一人带六个孩子，但又不能不干活，不然食堂不给饭吃。后来马老人带着孩子靠织席织缇帽添补家用，还时常因为家里穷被人看不起。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wang Shihua (b. 1926) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, Wang recalls the life after 1949. After being demobilized from the army in 1954, Wang worked as the leader and then the secretary of the production team. He explains the operation of and differences between elementary and advanced agricultural producers' cooperatives and people's commune. To join the cooperatives, people had to pay a certain amount of money. If one did not have enough money, while poor and lower-middle peasants could borrow money from the credit union with zero interest rate, rich peasants and landlords had to pay the interest. Because of its reed field, Shaziying Village did not suffer as much as others during the Great Famine. Many girls made mats with reeds for extra money. No one starved to death but several old people died of constipation. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
王士华1926年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村民。在这段口述中，王老人讲述了建国以后的生活。王老人1954年当兵回来以后当大队长，后来当了书记。王老人解释了初级社、高级社、人民公社的区分和运作。当时入社得花钱，贫下中农入社钱不够，就由信用社无息贷款，但富农、地主贷款就得花利息。大饥荒时期沙子营比别的村强的地方在于村里产苇子，好多女孩子都靠编席赚钱。当时村里饿死的没有，但有老人因为上火便秘去世。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jin Huilan (b. 1936) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, Jin recalled the life from Civil War to the Great Famine. During the Sino-Japanese War, most men in the village did not dare to sleep at home, worrying they would be dragged to join the army. The Communist party forced the students to go to school, but at the same time they had to hide from the Japanese. During the collectivization, whoever did not join the People's Commune would be criticized and punished. When the Miyun Reservoir was being built during the Great Famine, all the men (except for the physically challenged) went to build the reservoir, while all the women had to build the roads, including those who were pregnant or had little kids to take care of. Due to the lack of food provided by the canteen of their production team, Jin ate all kinds of tree barks. Many people got sick, developed big bellies and eventually died. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.

金慧兰1936年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村村民。在这段口述中，金老人回忆了从解放前到大饥荒时期的生活。抗日战争时期村里的男的怕被抓去当兵,不敢回家睡觉。学生们一边被共产党逼着去上学，一边得躲着怕被日本人发现。合作化时期虽说自由入社，但不入社就会被批斗。大饥荒时适逢北京修密云水库，村里男的除了瘸子拐子都要去修水库，女的就算怀孕或者带着孩子也得去修路。生产队食堂供应的粮食不够，金老人吃过各种树皮，好多人都得了大肚子病死了。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zhang Fenglan (b. 1949) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, Zhang recalls the life during the Great Famine when everyone had to eat at the communal canteen. During that time Zhang went to the communal canteen every morning to get thin congee for breakfast, and had only one bun for lunch. Zhang only studied at school for one and half years, during which time she always picked up firewood after class.
张凤兰1949年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村民。在这段口述中，张老人回忆了大饥荒时期吃食堂的经历。当时张老人早上去生产队打稀粥，中午只吃一个窝头。张老人只念了一年半书，还得经常在放学后到外面拾柴火。

did.unittitle: Meng Shiwu and Qi Tengyuan | 蒙士武&齐腾远

dao.xlink:title: Interview with Meng Shiwu and Qi Tengyuan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meng Shiwu (b. 1945) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. Qi Tengyuan (b. 1951) was married to Meng and therefore moved to Shaziying Village. In this interview, Meng and Qi recall the life during the Great Famine. Meng points out, because of the natural disaster, poor economy and the debt owed to Soviet Union, it was a very difficult time for the whole nation. People in the countryside lived on the work points earned through working at the production team, so they could not make much money. During the Great Famine, Qi was not married yet so stayed at home in northeast China. The life there was even harder. Her little sister had chondropathy because of malnutrition. Some people even dug mud in the river to eat.
蒙士武1945年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村民，齐腾远1951年出生，年轻时嫁给蒙老人，搬到了沙子营。在这段口述中，两位老人回忆了大饥荒时期吃食堂的经历。蒙老人指出，当时自然灾害，国民经济紧张，再加上要还苏联的债，所以特别困难。农村人靠挣工分，根本赚不到什么钱。大饥荒时期齐老人还没结婚，住在东北老家，生活更加困难，她的小妹子因为营养不良得了软骨病，村里甚至有人挖河里的泥来吃。

did.unittitle: Zhang Qixiang and Wang Shufeng | 张启祥&王淑凤

dao.xlink:title: Interview with Zhang Qixiang and Wang Shufeng

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zhang Qixiang (b. 1941) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. Wang Shufeng (b. 1941) was married to Zhang and therefore moved to Shaziying in 1962. In this interview, Zhang and Wang talk about the life during the Great Famine. Because of malnutrition, many people had edema, but thanks to the two jins of soy beans assigned for each patient by the government, no one starved to death in their village. Many people went to pick up sweet potato leaves and other edible things in the fields so that they could send them to places like Sichuan and Guangxi where the famine was worse. For every four jins of such "foods", the government would provide 1 jin of grains in exchange. Those days, because of hunger people would eat anything. Once a horse died in the village, so many people rushed to eat the meat. However, it was a sick horse so many people got food poison and were sent to the hospital. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
张启祥1941年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村民。王淑凤1941年出生，1962年搬到沙子营嫁给张启祥。在这段口述中，两位老人回忆了大饥荒时期的生活。那几年好多人因为营养不良得了浮肿病，所幸病人可以得到两斤黄豆补充营养，才不至于饿死。当时很多人去地里捡白薯叶等吃的，运到四川、广西支援当地，支援四斤政府就给一斤粮食。那阵人什么都吃，有一回村里死了一匹马，好多人去吃，结果都食物中毒送医院了。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Xu Yuzhen (b. 1926) was married into Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, Xu, suffering from memory loss, talks about her lifelong hardship. Her husband used to beat her all the time, and now her kids do not treat her well either.
徐玉珍1926年出生，年轻时嫁到北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营。徐老人年纪大了，记忆力不好。在这段口述中，她讲述了自己的艰苦生活。以前一直挨丈夫的打，现在孩子也不好好照顾她。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wu Zhanting (b. 1935) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, Wu talks about the life during Land Reform. Born as a poor peasant, Wu gained 3 mu fields during the Land Reform. However, he refused to move into a landlord's place when he could. According to Wu, the landlord that his dad worked for treated them very well, so during the Land Reform when the officials asked his dad to take food from the landlord he refused to do so.
吴占廷1935年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村民。在这段口述中，吴老人回忆了土改时候的情况。吴老人出身贫农，土地平分的时候分到了三亩地，但让他搬到地主家时吴老人决定不搬。据吴老人回忆，他爸爸给扛活的那家地主对他爸爸很好，土地平分的时候分给他爸爸的粮食他爸爸也没有要。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rong Shutang (b. 1920) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing and he was a teacher before retirement. In this interview, Rong recalled what happened before the Liberation and during the Land Reform as well as the later checkup. During the Sino-Japanese War, there were Red Eye Army who claimed to fight against Japanese but in fact were just bandits with secret relationship to the Communist party. The Communist party did not arrive in the village until 1937. Ever since then, they always held secret meetings with poor people in the evenings. During the Land Reform, many people had to forgo and move out of their own places for collectivization, but there was no standard criteria. Whoever refused to follow the orders would be beaten up. Many teachers, including Rong himself suffered ill-treatment during the checkup—wrongly accused, beaten up and even beaten to death. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.

荣树堂1920年出生于北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村，退休前当了一辈子教师。在这段口述中，荣老人回忆了解放前的日子和当年沙营子村土改、扫房、复查的情况。抗日战争时期先有的红眼军，明着抗日实际上是土匪，但也和共产党有关系，后来37年以后慢慢开始有了共产党，经常晚上开秘密穷人会。扫房没有固定标准，被选中就必须搬走，不然就要挨打。复查期间很多教师也受到了不合理待遇，不少人被冤枉、挨打，甚至被打死，老人自己也挨了批斗。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rong Baotang (b. 1926) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, Rong talks about the life before and after 1949. Instead of receiving formal education, Rong went to Beijing to work as an apprentice when he was 11. Later he went back home and worked for several landlords. In 1947 Rong joined the Communist party's army. During his 5-year army life, Rong participated in many battles and joined the Korean War in 1950. He got injured in 1952 and was demobilized after treatment. Upon arriving home, Rong worked as the production team leader and later was transferred to work in Beijing. Rong also showed his Demobilization Certificate in this interview. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
荣宝堂1926年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村民。在这段口述中，荣老人回忆了解放前后的生活。荣老人11岁就上北京当学徒，后来又给地主家干活，没念过什么书。1947年荣老人应征入伍，当了5年兵，打过不少仗，50年参加朝鲜战争，52年挂彩，疗完伤后荣老人便回国复员，在乡里当大队长，后来又调去北京上班。在这段口述里，荣老人还展示了他的复员证。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Liu Guiying (b. 1941) got married and moved to Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing in 1961. In this interview Liu recalls the life during the Great Famine. While eating at the communal canteen, once in Xiaodian Village, someone took a pack of white powder and asked people to sprinkle it on their buns. It turned out to be some kind of poison and many people got sick and were sent to the hospital. Because of poverty, those days people would try all kinds of ways to make a little bit more money. Liu's dad used to sell little handmade gongs made of willow branches. Liu's husband did carpentry work at the production team to earn extra money. Some people traded the assigned oil for money. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.

刘桂英1941年出生，1961年嫁到北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营。在这段口述中，刘老人回忆了大饥荒时期的生活。吃食堂的时候有次小店大队有人拿了一包白面让大家搁在饽饽上吃，结果那是信金（一种毒药），好多人因此中毒住院。当时生活贫穷，大家想尽办法挣钱，刘老人的爸爸用柳条编成小锣拿出去卖，刘老人的丈夫在生产队里做木工挣一点钱，还有的人把发的油料卖了换点钱。|Transcripts for this interview and more may be available under the 'Documents' link above.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rong Shuxun (b. 1927) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, Rong talks about the life before and after Land Reform. In 1947 Rong was dragged to join the Communist Party's army. After spending 3 to 4 months in the army, he went home and that was when the Land Reform started. In June and July rich peasants and landlords started to be forced to move out of their own houses, and in November Decree on Land was carried out. According to Rong, people started to secretly join the Communist Party since 1947 and he also joined the party when he just reached 20.
荣树勋1927年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村民。在这段口述中，荣老人回忆了土改前后的情况。荣老人47年被拉去当兵，当了三四个月，回家正赶上土改。47年6月、7月扫房，11月实行《土地法》。老人还回忆说，47年就开始有人秘密加入共产党，刚满20的他也在别人介绍下入了党。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zhang Jiuping (b. 1957) is a resident of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, Zhang talks about her lifelong hardship. Categorized as rich peasant and landlord, Zhang's family suffered a lot. Her mom had to take care of four kids while her dad worked at a factory in Beijing. Because of poverty, Zhang had to quit school in the second grade to take care of her younger sisters. At the age of 13, Zhang replaced her mom and went to work in the production team with her elder brother while making mats in the evening for extra money. When working at the Jinji River in 1977, her brother developed mental illness. After sparing no effort to help him get cured and get married, Zhang herself was eventually able to get married with the boyfriend she had dated for years. In 1984 when Zhang was pregnant with her son, the one-child policy started to be strictly carried out in the countryside. To hide from people from the government, Zhang had to travel to relatives' places on a tractor. Worried about being forced into abortion, she did not dare to go to the hospital even though the baby was due soon. After all kinds of hardship, she finally gave birth to the son at home. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.

张久平1957年出生，是顺义区杨镇沙子营村民。在这段口述中，张老人回忆了自己艰苦的一生。张老人家里是扫房户，妈妈一人带着四个孩子，父亲在北京工厂上班。因为家里穷，张老人念到小学二年级就辍学在家照顾妹妹。她十三岁代替妈妈，和哥哥一起上生产队干活，同时晚上织席添补家用。77年挖金鸡河时张老人的哥哥受刺激得了精神病，等费尽心思帮助哥哥痊愈并结婚之后，张老人自己才得以和处了好多年的对象结婚。84年张老人怀上儿子时适逢计划生育，为了躲避政府的人，张老人大着肚子坐着拖拉机逃到亲戚家，临产了也不敢上医院怕被迫流产，最后几经周折才在家里生下了儿子。

did.unittitle: Zhang Jiuxi and Rong Shunzhi | 张久希&荣顺志

dao.xlink:title: Interview with Zhang Jiuxi and Rong Shunzhi

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zhang Jiuxi (b. 1949) and Rong Shunzhi (b. 1949) are residents of Shaziying Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, they recall the life during the Great Famine. In 1958 when people could eat whatever they wanted at the communal canteen, food went gone very quickly, so the officials from the production team went to everyone's home to check if they were hiding any food. To make space for the communal canteen, many people had to move, including Zhang's family. One of Zhang's uncles was a deserter from the army, so in order to protect this brother, Zhang's dad gave away one of his sons to the cadre of the production team. Zhang Jiuru, who is Zhang Jiuxi's relative, reported his own family members to the government so that he could become the accountant of the production team. He even changed the categorization of Zhang Jiuxi's family from middle peasants to rich peasants. However, because of corruption, Zhang Jiuru was later arrested and sentenced with 12 years in prison. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.

张久希和荣顺志1949年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇沙子营村民。在这段口述中，两位老人回忆了大饥荒吃食堂时的经历。58年敞开肚皮吃饭的时候，粮食一下吃没了，生产队就上老百姓家里翻，看有没有人私藏粮食。当时为了给生产队的食堂让地方，好多人都被迫搬家，包括张老人家。张老人的叔叔当兵逃回了家，为了保护自己的弟弟，老人的爸爸把一个儿子送给了生产队的干部。张老人家的亲戚张久如为了自己当官，举报家人，并在四清时把张老人家从中农改成了富农，后来成了大队会计的张久如因为贪污被抓进监狱，被判了12年。

did.unittitle: Wangqu Village | 顺义区南彩镇望渠村

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wangqu Village is located in Shunyi District, Beijing. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Shao Yuzhen.
望渠村位于北京市顺义区南彩镇。村民的录像采访人是邵玉珍。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Shao Dechun (b. 1927) is a resident of Wangqu Village, Nancai Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. In this interview, Shao talks about his experience of building the reservoir during the Great Famine. Many of the assigned grains were embezzled by the leaders at the production team, which resulted in the starvation of others.
邵德纯1927年出生，是北京市顺义区南彩镇望渠村村民。在这段口述中，邵老人回忆了大饥荒时期修水库的经历。当时粮食好多都给指导员贪污了，老百姓根本吃不饱。

did.unittitle: Xinzhuangzi Village | 顺义区杨镇辛庄子

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Xinzhuangzi Village is located in Shunyi District, Beijing. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Shao Yuzhen.
辛庄子村于北京市顺义区杨镇。村民的录像采访人是邵玉珍。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Liu Huaiyou (b. 1930) is a resident of Xingzhuangzi Village, Yang Town, Shunyi District, Beijing. After graduating from a normal school, Liu has been teaching for most of his life. In this interview, Liu recalled the life before and after 1949 as well as during Great Famine and the Cultural Revolution. During the Civil War when he was still in middle school, Liu secretly joined the Communist Party in Beijing and helped the army hide and transfer goods. During the Land Reform, Liu's family was identified as rich peasants and therefore forced to move out of their own big house. The eight of them had to share two shabby rooms, in which, after some repairs, Liu is still living today. No law was strictly enforced back then, so robberies conducted by bandits were prevailing. Many people attacked and revenged others under the name of class struggle. In spite of this, Liu, who used to live under the cruel control of the Japanese, remains a patriot. During the Great Famine, Liu was provided only one steamed bun per meal, together with some radish slices. In 1966 during the Cultural Revolution when he was teaching in Shaling, he was framed and falsely accused of being an anti-revolutionist. Liu then had to go back home for reeducation through labor. It was not until 1979 that he was able to go back to Shaling to teach. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.

刘怀友1930年出生，是北京市顺义区杨镇辛庄子村村民，从师范学校毕业后教了一辈子书。在这段口述中刘老人回忆了解放前后、大饥荒以及文革时期的生活。解放前还在读中学的刘老人加入了共产党的北京地下工作者，帮八路军转运物资。土改期间，刘老人全家被定为富农成分，八口人被迫搬离自家大宅，住进两间危房。这房子后来经过修补，刘老人住到现在。当时并不讲究法律，土匪盛行，四处抢劫，经常有人借着斗争的名义滥用刑罚，打击报复。尽管如此，经历过抗战时期日本人残酷统治的刘老人仍一心爱国。大饥荒时期，刘老人一顿饭就吃一个饽饽，吃不饱就只能吃萝卜丝。66年文革期间，刘老人被人诬陷为反革命，被迫从原先教书的沙岭回到老家劳动改造，直到79年才回沙岭教书。

did.unittitle: Zhaixia Village | 河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zhaixia Village is located in Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Ye Zuyi.
寨下村位于广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇。村民的录像采访人是叶祖艺。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Rijin (b.1938) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. After the communization, the commune claimed that they had a harvest of 100 thousand jin per acre. Many people died of hunger. For instance, Ye Zuoxing went to the eating hall to fetch porridge for his mother, but could not help eating all of it on his way home. His mother died afterwards. People ate all kinds of famine foods and either died of sickness or starvation. Since Ye went to the mining field to work and sold Chinese pancakes on the street, he did not suffer much hunger. During the Cultural Revolution, Ye was a Red Guard. He also remembers that many educated youths from the city came to live with the villagers. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.

叶日锦（ 1938年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。据叶老人说，公社化期间，公社曾说大话宣称亩产十万斤。很多人饿死，比如叶佐杏去食堂打粥，想拿回去给他母亲吃，但他走到半路把粥喝完了，家里的母亲后来就饿到死了。人们吃烂番薯骗、野菜、糠、布菜、山将树、黄狗头等，或者病死，或者饿死。老人由于当时去矿场做工，后来又在街上做饼，没太忍受过饥饿。文革期间，老人当过红卫兵。老人还回忆了一些从城里来的知青，和他们同吃同住。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Shengbing (b.1931) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. His mother died in 1960 after eating some wild plants, which made her body swelling. Ye worked in a mining factory from the 1970s to the 1990s, when the factory went bankrupt. His job was to nail screws to machines. He worked in a dusty environment, which hurt his brain; he also had leg problems because of that job. Since he was working for a commune, he has no pension right now; the government also does not give him any subsidies.
叶升丙（1948年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。1960年，他的母亲吃了野菜，身体肿胀，后来去世。叶老人曾在矿厂工作，从七十年代一直到九十年代矿厂倒闭，做打禾机的螺丝。由于工作环境粉尘很大，对脑部神经造成了伤害，后来腿也落下了毛病。由于当时是给公社工作，所以他现在没有任何退休金，政府也没有给他任何的补助。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Pingmu (b.1932) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. In his 20s, Ye joined the local commune and started to farming collectively. Ye described that experience as like being held in a cage pig—they were not allowed to do anything else. During the Famine, they did not have rice, so Ye ate lots of sweet potatoes. In the 1960s, Ye's grandfather, together with some other aged people, were starved to death.
叶平幕（1932年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。叶老人二十几岁加入公社耕田。叶老人形容当时的人们如同被关在猪笼里一样，不准做其它的事。饥荒期间，没有白米饭吃，老人吃了很多番薯片。六十年代，老人的爷爷和其它几个老人被饿死。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Huang Guo (b.1926) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. After the communization, people could only buy bad sweet potatoes, which tasted terrible. When running out of sweet potatoes, people started to use dried sweet potatoes vines to make porridge. Ye's mother, after eating the porridge, had a swollen stomach and soon died. They also ate beans. Ye's son was so starved that he could not stop crying; he also had diarrhea overnight after having bean leaves. When Ye reaped crops, she secretly hid many crops in her pants' pockets, because only the stolen food truly belonged to her. Her husband once stole two sweet potatoes, got revealed and lost two days of food.
黄果（1926年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。公社化的时候， 只能去买苦味的烂番薯吃。后来番薯吃完了，就晒干番薯叶煮粥喝，而老人的母亲因为吃这个， 肚子肿起来，被胀死了。后来老人家种黄豆吃，她的儿子饿得大哭，吃黄豆叶，结果一夜拉肚子。 收割谷子的时候，由于割到再多也是公家的，偷到才是自己的，老人利用各种借口把谷子偷偷放进裤兜。老人的丈夫曾经偷了两条番薯，被发现后，被扣了两天的粮食。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Huang Qiu (b. 1927) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. After the communization, the commune had several eating halls in the area and that was when people start to get hungry. Even when someone was celebrating a baby after being born twenty days, people could only get sweet potato porridge. After year, they lost their own field and had to get food from the production team based on the number of their family members. They also brought their children everywhere to attend the commune's meetings.The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
黄秋（ 1927年生） 是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。公社化以后，几个食堂集体煮饭吃，人们就开始挨饿了，就算有孩子满二十天办酒席，大家也只能吃番薯粥。一年后他们耕的田给没收了，只能去生产队按人口称粮食。他们还背着小孩到处去开公社化的会议。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Huang Shiying (b. 1931) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. After the communization, she did not suffer from hunger because she was a cadre and her husband was the headmaster of the local elementary school. Although it was not allowed to cook at home, Huang's family got food with food coupons and secretly cooked at home. When people were getting classified, her family was almost considered as landlords because they had three shops and several fields. Her grandfather was often denounced. They managed to get classified as rich peasants later to escape more miseries.
黄石英 (1931年生) 是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。公社化的时候，她没有饿到，因为她是个干部，丈夫又是当时的小学校长。虽然当时个人不准开伙，他们家每个月都有粮票领粮，领回来后就偷偷在家里搭个灶做饭。在划成分时，她家在镇上有三家店，又有很多田地，很多人都要把她家划分为地主，她爷爷天天被人拖着批斗。但后来他们努力让家里被划成了富农，幸免于难。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zhou Huodi (b.1932) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. During the three years of the Great Famine, Zhou's husband sold vats to get potatoes, corns and wheat. She once lived on just rice, not suffering too much from the hunger. Afterwards, people got so hungry that they started stealing food. Zhou ate pork out of a dead pig, which made her out of milk, and her less-than-one-year-old daughter starved to death as a result. Many people died back then, including Zhou's Uncle and mother; people refused to help burying her mother's body unless they were given food in return.
周火娣（1932年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。 在"三年饥饿" 中，她的丈夫卖缸换番薯片、粟米和麦子（不去卖缸就要被扣公分），她曾一日三顿干饭吃到饱，竟然没太挨饿。 后来，人们饥饿难耐只能偷食物吃。周老人在生下一女后，吃了死猪肉，导致未满周岁的女儿没奶喝，被饿死了。那几年间，多人饿死，包括老人的大爷和母亲，而人们一定要吃了东西才肯帮忙埋葬她母亲的尸体。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Yueming (b.1938) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. Ye explains how they calculated their work points and how they survived the hunger afterwards. Ye's brother-in-law was an officer in Guangxi, and brought him thirty jin of rice. Since they were not allowed to cook, they cooked the rice at night and ate cold rice balls the next day. His brother-in-law also got two little pigs back. Ye fed the pigs with human breast milk so that they could grow into adult pigs. Later he sold the pigs to build his house. In 1959, with some other villagers, he escaped to find work in Jiangxi. They begged for food and worked different jobs on their way. They got imprisoned for this after they were back. Ye listed details of 5 villagers who died of starvation.

叶月明（1938年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。叶老人讲了当时的工分和后来的饥饿。当时， 叶老人的姐夫在广西当军官，带了三十斤米回来，白天不敢生火做饭，只能晚上做，白天就吃前一晚准备的冷饭团； 他姐夫还托人从广西带了两个刚出生的小猪回来，他们偷偷用人奶喂养， 养大后卖了一千多块钱，用来盖房子。1959年，他和另外几个人偷跑去江西找活干，一路上讨饭、打工，后来回到村里被关了起来。叶老人列举了5位死于饥荒的人的详细情况。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Yaolang (b.1938) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. Ye learned tailoring with his father after elementary school and then taught himself painting bed boards. He went to places to paint boards to escape the Great Famine. Ye recollects that, during the Great Leap Forward, the production team planted crops on two sides of the road just to impress their leaders, and used soil to fake fertilizers. The production team also spilled too many crop seeds and gained no harvest. They put layers of sweet potato vines on the field, which did not lead to more sweet potatoes at all.
叶耀浪（ 1938年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。他读完小学后跟着父亲学裁缝，然后又自学画床板画，走村过县到别人家里画床板画，借此在三年饥荒中没有过分挨饿。老人回忆，大跃进期间，生产队在公路两边种东西给领导看，用田泥假装在公路边堆肥。生产队把谷种满田撒下去，秧船日夜播种，不过这样却反而颗粒无收。 而在番薯田放了十几层番薯藤叶，也根本种不出更多的番薯。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Yinying (b.1933) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. Ye recollects that many people would hope someone would die and have a funeral, so that they could go and help to have some food in return. When Gaolang's father passed away, Ye's husband went to offer a hand, but Gaolang's mother hid all the food to save it for her children. When people helped carrying the coffin and did not get food, they would complain.
叶银英(1933年生) 是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。叶老人回忆说，当时很多人盼着有人去世、办丧事，这样如果去帮忙的话可以吃点东西。 当时高浪的父亲去世，她丈夫去帮忙，高浪母亲却把粥藏起来不给帮忙的人吃，给孩子们吃。抬棺材的人出了力却没东西吃，就会有些怨气。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Xiao Meiying (b. 1931) was born in Shantou, Guangdong Province. In this interview, Xiao recalls her life full of hardship. During the Japanese Occupation, Xiao fled from her hometown to Zhai Town, Guangdong Province when she was 12. She was then sold to a landlord and lived like a slave. She got married at 18 and moved to Zhaixia Village. Xiao also talks about her experiences during the Great Famine.
肖妹英1931年出生于广东汕头，是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。在这段口述中，肖老人回忆了自己艰苦的一生。日本占领时期，12岁的肖老人逃难来到寨镇，被人贩卖给地主，过着非人的生活，18岁嫁到寨下村。肖老人还回忆了大饥荒时的经历。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Hengli is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. During the Great Famine, his wife got caught when stealing potatoes, so the production team did not give her food for two meals, which only made his wife steal other foods. People stole all kinds of things and ate all kinds of things, but people did not eat people. Five people in Ye's family died of starvation: His grandfather went to Hebei's "steaming team" to cure his swelling body, but died soon after he returned. His grandmother was so hungry that she could only stay in bed, and later she died with swollen and yellowish limbs. His father was falsely charged with stealing vats and fined 20 RMB; he went away to find food but never came back. He does not know how exactly his uncle and nephew starved to death.

叶恒利是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。饥荒期间，叶老人的老婆偷番薯被捉到，被停了两餐饭，于是就继续偷别的食物吃。当时他们什么都偷，什么都吃，但没有人吃人。他家有五个人都被饿死了：他的爷爷去河背的"蒸病队"蒸水肿病，回来没两天就死了；奶奶饿得在床上无力动弹，手脚肿胀发黄，不久死去；父亲曾经被冤枉偷缸，被罚了20块钱，后来出门去别的地方找吃的东西，再也没回来，估计在路上被饿死了；他的叔叔和侄子具体怎样被饿死了，他也不清楚。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Jingying (b.1936) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. Ye is married to Ye Pingmo. At the start of the communization, the management went well and she could have rice for every meal. After the commune is incorporated, their food is taken away to share with all the community members. Ye mentions that the production team put three fields of rice on the same spot, and all the plants died. Ye's father was a party branch secretary in charge of that area. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.

叶敬英(1936年生)是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民，丈夫是叶平漠。公社化初期，公社管理有秩序，她可以三顿吃干饭到饱，但后来公社集中，他们所有的粮食都被拿走，大家一起吃，食物就紧缺了。叶老人还提到了当时生产队把三块田的稻谷堆到一块田上，后来稻谷就都死了，人们更加没有东西吃。叶老人父亲当时是党支书，管理那片区域，对她有所照顾，所以她情况还不错，可以去食堂舀粥喝。文革期间，老人的父亲及其它干部被揭发各种罪行，然后被吊起来批斗。有人被批斗得难以忍受，便借口方便，在茅坑里上吊自杀，而叶老人的父亲被管制得甚至无法自杀，而平反后只补到了八千块钱。老人入过初级社和高级社，改革开放以后还在继续耕田。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Pingmo (b.1932) is from Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. He joined a commune in his twenties and did farming till the Chinese Economic Reform. During the Great Famine, apart from being forced to stay in a production team, Ye went to Shaoguan City to work in a brickyard. Being paid hourly, he had barely enough food, while his father at home died of hunger. Soon afterwards, his elder son, Ye Zuyan, who was only three years old, starved to death as well. In the eighties, Ye worked in graveyards, till he could not. After that, he stayed in the village living on elderly pension and took care of his grandson. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
叶平漠(1932年生)居住于广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村，二十多岁就入社耕田，直到改革开放。饥荒那几年，他除了被扣在生产队做工，还去了韶关市砖厂打工，按劳取酬以勉强果腹，然而在此期间，留在家中的父亲却饿死了，不久后他的三岁的大儿子叶祖炎也被饿死了。八十年代以后，叶老人从事了二十多年葬风水地的工作，至体力不支，便在村里领老人粮，照顾孙子。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zeng Man (b.1929) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. Zeng took part in the denunciation of landlords during the Cultural Revolution. She went to landlords' homes to tie people up and carry their properties. The landlords were put in pig cages and their properties were shared between other villagers. The Red Guards wronged many people. After the communization, many starved to death. The production team put too many seeds in the field, and could not get enough harvest afterwards. People ran out of food quickly. Zeng did not suffer hunger because her family works at the eating hall and secretly brought back food. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
曾漫 (1929年生) 是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。曾老人在文化大革命期间参加过斗地主，去地主家捆人、搬财产，把人放在猪笼里，而参加斗地主的人可以瓜分地主的财物。红卫兵冤枉了很多人。公社化以后，很多人饿死。生产队用秧船密密麻麻地插秧，收粮食的时候割不到粮食，不久就没东西吃了。老人家里有人在食堂工作，可以偷拿食物回来，所以她没有挨饿。

did.unittitle: Huang Yuqiang (Yuxiang) | 黄雨强 (黄羽祥)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Huang Yuqiang (Yuxiang) (b.1931) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. Huang was born in Shangtongkeng. He was the only child at home but his parents, because of poverty, sold him to a landlord in Tangwu. Later he was sold to Jiangxi. After being classified as a landlord and deprived of properties, Huang was banished to Zhaixia Village and stayed watched for the next twenty-five years. He was denounced day and night and paraded in the village. He got no subsidies after being vindicated in 1978. Huang also remembers that he got the worst field and no other properties; he only carried sedan chairs and ploughed field to earn a scanty income.
黄雨强（1931年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。老人出生于上桐坑，是家里独子，但由于家庭困难被父母卖到了塘屋一户地主家，后来地主家又把自己卖到了江西。老人被划成地主没收财产后，就被土改队发配来寨下村，被管制了二十五年。他被日夜批斗，游街游村，1978年平反后的补贴也没拿到。老人还回忆了被分到最差的田地，一无所有，只能扛轿子、耕田换取微薄收入。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Huang Yujiao (b.1935) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. When Huang was seven years old, she became a child bride. After the liberation, she got divorced after being abused. She was then married to Ye Hengqin. Huang says that they sprinkled seeds instead of planting them. Following orders from higher authorities, they put many seeds within the same field and the crops could not live. During the Famine, people ate many kinds of famine foods. Someone ate twelve jin of zucchinis and got bloated to death. Someone died after eating too many bamboo shoots.
黄玉娇（1935年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。黄老人七岁的时候被抱来做童养媳，解放后，因受不了前夫的打骂，与之离婚，嫁给现在的丈夫叶恒钦。黄老人说以前的谷是撒下去的，不是插下去的，按照上面的规定，撒的很厚，谷物根本无法生存。她还回忆了饥荒期间，人们吃各种东西，有点人吃了十二斤番瓜，肚子胀大；有人吃竹笋吃死了。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Huang Yun (b.1929) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. After the communization, people got porridge from the eating hall. But children would not eat the watery porridge, so they had to recook it to make it thicker. Huang was so hungry that she got sick and went to eat at the elderly home. Sometimes she got a rare potato from the wild, which was snatched away. Many old people starved to death. They had no money to buy any kind of food. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
黄运（1929年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。公社化以后，人们从食堂领粥吃，但粥太稀了，小孩不愿意吃，只能烧稠一点给他们。黄老人曾经饿得病了，去养老院吃饭才好一些。有时候好不容易挖到番薯，又被没收，很多老人饿死了，没钱买东西吃。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Shengji (b.1927) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. He started to sell vats as a teenager and worked in a production team. Ye recollects that in the days of communization, people ate in a big hall, and many foods were wasted. Running out of food, the team asked people to find food on their own. Ye walked to Qingzhou to sell vats and started to exchange vats for a sleeping bed or potato slices. Once, Qingzhou's soldiers got him and confiscated his food, because selling vats is not approved. Ye still sold vats after he turned 85 years old as a habit, though he couldn't sell many. His main income is his offspring's red packets of money at festivals.

叶升基（1927年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。他十多岁开始在县城的各个地方卖缸，也在生产队工作过。叶老人回忆当年，公社化吃大食堂，有很多粮食被浪费掉了，后来没了食物，大队就叫大家自己出去找吃的。于是，老人走路去青州卖缸，后来开始用缸换床睡、换番薯片吃，有一次换番薯片被青州民兵发现 ，声称卖缸没有经过公社的批准， 没收了食物。叶老人85岁了仍以卖缸为生，尽管赚不到钱，却成为了一种习惯。老人的经济来源主要逢年过节孙子女和外孙子女给的红包钱。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Shengcuo (b.1934) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. He recollects many people that died in the Great Famine.|叶升错（1934年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。他回忆了很多三年饥饿中死亡的人。 Zeng Linjian (b.1931) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. As he recounts, after the communization, people ran out of food, and had to ate unpalatable leaves and had potato vines in place of tea. An old lady in the village carried a cage for chicken to steal wheats from the production team's fields; her aunt at home wanted to remarry someone for food. Zeng's father as well as her first and second husbands were all starved to death. In the family, she is the only senior alive now.
曾林俭(1931年生)是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。据老人回忆，公社化之后，粮食缺乏，人们把某种难闻的树叶当成吃食，还把番薯藤叶晒干当茶水喝。村里有一位婆婆曾经拿着鸡笼去生产队的田地里偷谷穗吃，而她家里的大娘因为没有食物，一心想要改嫁。曾老人的父亲、两任丈夫都在那几年被饿死了。时至今日，家中那代人只剩下她一个了。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zeng Linjian (b.1931) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. As he recounts, after the communization, people ran out of food, and had to ate unpalatable leaves and had potato vines in place of tea. An old lady in the village carried a cage for chicken to steal wheats from the production team's fields; her aunt at home wanted to remarry someone for food. Zeng's father as well as her first and second husbands were all starved to death. In the family, she is the only senior alive now.
曾林俭(1931年生)是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。据老人回忆，公社化之后，粮食缺乏，人们把某种难闻的树叶当成吃食，还把番薯藤叶晒干当茶水喝。村里有一位婆婆曾经拿着鸡笼去生产队的田地里偷谷穗吃，而她家里的大娘因为没有食物，一心想要改嫁。曾老人的父亲、两任丈夫都在那几年被饿死了。时至今日，家中那代人只剩下她一个了。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chen Qianmei (b. 1928) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. According to Chen, after the communization, people did not have much food, but they still had to hand in their food to the commune. Adults could only eat dirty things and slices of sweet potatoes, so that their children could have some rice. Sometimes, Chen's husband shouldered limestones into towns to sell and bought some rice. He worked till late at night and came back home.
陈千妹 (1928年生) 是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。陈老人回忆，公社化那几年人们没东西吃，还得交公粮，成年人为了省米粮给孩子们，只能吃脏东西和番薯片。曾经，老人的丈夫挑着石灰去城里卖，换米吃，工作到深夜才回来。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Luo Meiyu (b. 1927) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. Luo talked briefly about her life: She was born in Chaozhou, married three times, gave birth to 11 children, sold 3 sons because there were no enough food to feed them. She also talked about the hard labor in the field. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
罗美玉（1923年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。罗老人大致讲了自己一生的经历：出生在潮州，嫁过三次，生了11个小孩，卖了3个儿子，因为粮食不够没法养。老人谈到在地里犁地耕地，非常辛苦。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Shiying (b.1938) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. Ye recollects that, during the Great Famine, people could only get two tablespoons of porridge from the eating hall every day, and ate them with steamed sweet potato slices at home. She also ate many other kinds of famine food and she could hardly find potatoes in the mountains after working for a whole day. Many people starved to death after the communization, including people in the elderly homes and maternities. The production team sprinkled seeds instead of actually planting them; they had no harvest, but reported the opposite to the higher authorities.
叶石英（1938年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。叶老人叙述了饥荒期间，人们在食堂里每人只能领两小勺粥，回家蒸番薯片跟粥一起吃。她当时还吃吃糠饼、野菜、山将树叶等等，上山挖一天都挖不到一个薯粮。很多人在公社化期间被饿死，养老院和妇产院也断粮。生产队撒秧，而不插秧，没有收成，却对上级汇报滿产。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Shengpeng (b.1942) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. He recollects many people's dates of death. Not that many people in the village died, because they hid food at home. Their food was never found, so they did not suffer that much hunger as other places.
叶升彭 （1942年生）围背村没饿死几个人，因为当时很多人偷偷留了粮食，没被搜出来，所以饥饿那几年饿得没其他地方厉害。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ye Xinji (b. 1927) is a resident of Zhaixia Village, Pengzhai Town, Heping County, Heyuan City, Guangdong Province. Ye recollects that during the collectivization, people farmed together and many just pretended to work, so they ran out of food. Ye and the interviewer Ye Zuyi's father often went fishing at night. He also went to Qingzhou with some other people to sell vats in return for sweet potatoes.
叶新基（1927年生）是广东省河源市和平县彭寨镇寨下村村民。叶老人回忆了公社化的时候，大家一起种田，很多人偷懒，于是没有食物吃。叶老人和采访人叶祖艺的父亲晚上去河里抓鱼吃。他当时和其它几个人去青州卖缸，换番薯片吃。

did.unittitle: Guanchong Village | 茂名市高州市宝光街道办荷木坡管理区关冲村

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Guanchong Village is located in Gaozhou County, Maoming City, Guangdong Province. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Wu Haizhu.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Li Qunying (b. 1939) is a resident of Guanchong Village, Guangdong Province. In this interview, Li talks about her lifelong hardship. Li's mother left home when she was 5, so she was raised by her father. After the Liberation, Li was sold to a family as their daughter. However, after frequently being beaten up, Li escaped several times and eventually went home with her father. She stayed at home until she got married in 1961. Due to the shortage of all kinds of materials, Li waited in line for a long time in order to get herself a pair of new shoes for the wedding. Later when she was working at the production team, in addition to the heavy workload, she had to get up before dawn to chop firewood. If she were late for work, her work points would be deducted. When the One-Child Policy was carried out, if someone did not have the vasectomy as required, his work points would be removed. In this interview, Li also sang many old songs.

李群英1939年出生，是广东省高州市宝光街道办荷木坡管理区关冲村村民。在这段口述中，李老人回忆了自己艰苦的一生。李老人五岁时妈妈离家出走，由爸爸独自带大。解放后，十多岁的李老人被卖给人家当女儿，但经常挨打，李老人逃了几次以后最终被爸爸带回家，从此便待在家中，直到1961年出嫁。当时物资匮乏，李老人结婚前为了买一双鞋，排了好久的队。后来李老人在生产队干活，工作特别辛苦，天还没亮就要出去砍柴，如果工作迟到就要扣工分。计划生育政策开始实行以后，如果不去结扎，生产队就不记工分。此外，李老人在这段口述中还唱了不少以前的歌。

did.unittitle: Liutong Village | 茂名市高州市宝光街道办荷木坡管理区留垌村

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Liutong Village is located in Gaozhou County, Maoming City, Guangdong Province. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Wu Haizhu.
留垌村位于广东省茂名市高州市宝光街道办荷木坡管理区。村民的录像采访人是吴海珠。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jiang Guifang (b. 1920) is a resident of Liutong Village, Guangdong Province. In this interview, Jiang recalls the life during the Great Famine. Though having given birth to five kids, Jiang did not obtain enough nutrients after the labor because of the famine. All she could eat was wild edible herbs rather than meat. As a result, as she grows older, she has developed many diseases. Back then if people in the village got sick, because of poverty, they could not afford a doctor but would just boil some herbs by themselves.
江桂芳1920年出生，是广东省高州市宝光街道办荷木坡管理区留垌村村民。在这段口述中，江老人回忆了大饥荒时的生活。江老人生了五个儿女，但因为饥荒，每天只能吃野菜，很少吃肉补充营养，导致年纪大了以后有很多病痛。当时如果生病也没有钱请医生，只能自己抓点草药煮水喝。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wu Daiwang (b. 1940) is a resident of Liutong Village, Guangdong Province. In this interview, Wu recalls the life during the Great Famine. Life became difficult since 1958. In addition to the scarcity of food and materials, the workload at the production was also very heavy. People usually had to work till midnight. In order to make extra money, Wu went out to work as a plasterer until he was over 40 years old. Many villagers went to work in other places. They handed in part of their income to the production team and kept the rest. Back then, although some people gave birth to kids, it was in general almost impossible to raise them up. Usually deemed very prestige, doctors, when called in, had to come to the village in sedan chairs.
吴代旺1940年出生，是广东省高州市宝光街道办荷木坡管理区留垌村村民。在这段口述中，吴老人讲述了大饥荒时期的生活。1958年开始生活变得困难，不仅缺衣少食，生产队的工作也特别辛苦，经常要干活干到三更半夜。为了多赚钱，吴老人出去做水泥工，一直做到四十多岁。村里不少人都出去干活，赚回来的钱一部分给生产队，剩下的自己用。当时虽然有人生小孩，但很难养大。那时候医生很高级，如果要请医生还得抬轿请来。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cheng Wenlan (b. 1936) is a resident of Liutong Village, Guangdong Province. In this interview, Cheng talks about the hardship during the Great Famine. In 1959 when Cheng was planting green vegetables for the production team, although the work was quite heavy, she at least did not need to worry about food. After getting married in 1960, Cheng moved to Hainan Province with her husband. To making a living, they tapped rubber trees for natural rubber. Compared to the hard work, the salaries they earned were very low. As a result, they always starved and their shabby house was only made of tree branches and other materials.
程文兰1936年出生，是广东省高州市宝光街道办荷木坡管理区留垌村村民。在这段口述中，程老人讲述了大饥荒时的艰苦生活。1959年程老人在生产队种青菜，虽然辛苦但有饭吃。60年结婚以后程老人和丈夫搬到海南，两人当工人，割橡胶树的橡胶，工作辛苦但工资不高，所以经常挨饿，住的房子也只是用树枝等搭出来的。

did.unittitle: Dongjieguan Village | 衡水市深州市杨家庄村

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dongjieguan Village is located in Shenzhou County, Hengshui City, Hebei Province. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Jia Nannan.
东街关村位于河北省衡水市深州市。村民的录像采访人是贾楠楠。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wu Xiuzhe (b. 1934) is a resident of Yangjiazhuang Village, Hebei Province. In this interview, Wu recalls the life during the Great Famine. Because of hunger, Wu tried wild herbs, green dates, raw eggplants and cabbage roots.
吴秀者1934年出生，是河北省衡水杨家庄村村民。在这段口述中，吴老人回忆了大饥荒时期的生活。当时为了填饱肚子，老人吃过野菜、青枣、生茄子、白菜疙瘩。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Xue Dajie (b. 1937) is a resident of Dongjieguan Village. In this interview Xue recalls the life during the Great Famine. During that time, in order to support the elderly and the children in the family, Xue had to mill the rice and plant grass for the production team.
薛大洁1937年出生，是河北省衡水东街关村村民。在这段口述中，薛老人回忆了大饥荒时期的生活。当时薛老人家上有老下有小，为了有饭吃，薛老人在家里给生产队碾稻子种草。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rui Zhan (b. 1927) is a resident of Dongjieguan Village, Hebei Province. In this interview, Rui talks about the hardship during the Great Famine. With 7 kids to feed, Rui's life was very difficult back then.
瑞沾1927年出生，是河北省衡水东街关村村民。在这段口述中，瑞老人回忆了大饥荒时期的挨饿经历。当时瑞老人家里有七个孩子，生活十分艰苦。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zheng Lanfen (b. 1942) is a resident of Yangjiazhuang Village, Hebei Province. In this interview, Zheng talks about the life during the Great Famine when she was working at the production team. The food given by the production team was far from enough: everyone could only get two jins of wheat when wheat was harvested and then some other grains in the Fall. People had to find wild herbs for extra sustenance and most kids suffered from malnutrition.
郑兰芬1942年出生，是河北省衡水杨家庄村村民。在这段口述中，郑老人讲述了大饥荒时期的生活。当时郑老人在生产队干活，发的粮食根本吃不饱。收麦子时一人分二斤麦子，到秋天再发点别的粮食，不够吃就只能挖野菜，孩子都因为缺乏营养发育不良。

did.unittitle: Yangjiazhuang Village | 深州市深州镇杨家庄村

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Yangjiazhuang Village is located in Shenzhou County, Hengshui City, Hebei Province. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Jia Nannan.
杨家庄村位于河北省衡水市深州市。村民的录像采访人是贾楠楠。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jia Futian (b. 1936) was born in Changchun, Jilin Province. During the Siege of Changchun in 1947, Jia fled to Yangjiazhuang Village, Hebei Province with his family. In this interview, Jia talks about the life during the siege and their fleeing, as well as other various experiences from the Liberation to the Cultural Revolution. After the Liberation, Jia went to work in Beijing. In 1958, as a Catholic, Jia expressed his disapproval of the government's religion policies. He was therefore sent to a farm for labor reeducation and experienced the Great Famine on the farm. He was not allowed to return home until 1969. After the Tangshan Earthquake in 1976, Jia went to work in Tangshan as a migrant worker. According to Jia, the work in Tangshan was much more grueling than the farm. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.

贾福田1936年出生于吉林省长春市，1947年长春围城时随家人逃难到河北省杨家庄村。在这段口述中，贾老人回忆了长春围城和逃难时的情况，以及解放后直到文革时的各种经历。解放后贾老人在北京工作。1958年，信奉天主教的贾老人因为对宗教政策不满，被发配到农场进行劳动改造，直到1969年才回家，期间经历了大饥荒艰苦的三年。1976年唐山大地震后老人去唐山充民工，据老人回忆，那段经历比在农场劳教时还要辛苦。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jia Fuyong (b. 1927) is a resident of Yangjiazhuang Village, Hebei Province. In this interview, Jia talks about the life during the Japanese occupation, the Great Famine and the Cultural Revolution. The Japanese arrived in the village in 1937 and stayed for 8 years. Later Jia was forced to join the army when he was still a teenager. During the Great Famine, people ate whatever they could find. In the campaign of "Destroy the Four Olds" during the Cultural Revolution, the birth certificates of Jia's family were accidentally burned, together with books of classical literature.
贾夫勇1927年出生，是河北省衡水杨家庄村村民。在这段口述中，贾老人讲述了解放前日本人占领时的生活，以及大饥荒和文革时期的经历。日本人1937年到的村里，待了8年。贾老人十几岁就被拉去当兵。大饥荒时，村民找到什么就吃什么。文革时除四旧，烧古书时贾老人家连出生证明都给误烧了。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jia Fukui (b. 1932)is a resident of Yangjiazhuang Village, Shenzhou Town, Shenzhou City, Hebei Province. He is the interviewer's grandfather. In this interview, Jia remembers that his big family lacked manpower to earn work credits during the Great Famine. Back then almost no vegetables could be harvested and all the tree leaves were eaten by the hungry people. Later many people went to work on the dam because they had enough food there. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
贾夫奎1932年出生，是河北省深州市深州镇杨家庄村村民。他是采访者的爷爷。在这段口述中，贾老人回忆了大饥荒时期他的一大家人因为缺少劳动力挣工分而挨饿的经历。大饥荒时期地里都长不出菜，树上的叶子都被人吃光了。后来大家都去挖水库，因为在那里能吃饱饭。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Li Yunnu (b. 1926) is a resident of Yangjiazhuang Village, Shenzhou Town, Shenzhou City, Hebei Province. Her body is not well due to the past. In this interview, Li talks about the different kinds of work she did and the starvation she experienced during the Great Famine. The transcript of this interview has been translated into English.
李允女1926年出生，是河北省深州市深州镇杨家庄村村民。她的身体有很多过去落下的毛病。 在这段口述中，李老人讲述了大饥荒期间她干的各种活和经受的饥饿。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Liu Shuming (b. 1935) is a resident of Yangjiazhuang Village, Hebei Province. In this interview, Liu talks about the life during two Great Famines around 1944 and 1958-60. She was 9 and went out begging for food with her older sister and they went to several villages without getting enough food. During the People's Commue canteen time, she had to find wild vegetables as there was still severe shortage of food.
刘淑明1935年出生，是河北省衡水杨家庄村村民。在这段口述中，刘老人讲述了1944年和1958-60年两次大饥荒时期的生活。刘老人9岁时和11岁的姐姐一起去要饭，走几个村子都吃不饱。吃食堂时，挖野菜，同样吃不饱。

did.unittitle: Daguo Village | 漯河市临颍县大郭乡大郭村

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Daguo Village is located in Lingying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Guo Rui.
大郭村位于河南省漯河市临颍县大郭乡。村民的录像采访人是郭睿。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Guo Dong (b.1919) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. Guo recollects that, in 1942, to escape the labor at home, he went to Xi'an to work at a brick kiln and did not starve. He heard of the breaching of the Yellow River and that many counties were flooded. In 1958, he had parents and children at home, but he could not feed them. Later, he went to work at a machinery factory to support himself.
郭东（1919年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。郭老人回忆了1942年，他说他为了躲拉壮丁，在西安砖窑工作，没在家挨饿。曾听说，黄河决堤，淹了好几个县。1958年，老人家里有父母、孩子，但是自己没能力给家里东西吃。他后来去机械厂做工，养活自己。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Guo Diankun (b.1934) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. He went to work at Baiguishan Reservoir in 1958 and was back at village in 1960. The production team let someone else to go to the reservoir instead and Guo stayed to raise animals. When people ate at the eating halls, since his mother worked in one of them, he could get some food from her.
郭电坤（1934年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。1958年去过白龟山水库，1960年回村，生产队照顾他，让别人替他去水库，他则在生产队养牲口。吃食堂的时候，他的母亲在食堂里工作，可以拿点东西吃。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Song Xiutian (b.1926) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. In 1942, he ran away from the village to solicit food. His grandfather, elder uncle, and one of the brothers died. In 1948, he took part in the revolution and helped to carry stretchers when Liberation Army fought the Kuomintang's ninth army. In 1949, the chairman of the local agriculture committee was replaced for his problematic lifestyle, and Song announced this decision. The former chairman committed suicide that night, and his family accused Song of illegal inquisition, after which Song was denounced by the party and put into prison for nine months. Later he became a cadre again, taught in the school and supervised many projects.

宋秀田（1926年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。1942年，宋老人逃荒到外地要饭，爷爷、大伯、三哥都死了。1948年，他参加革命，解放军攻打国民党十一师的时候，他去抬担架。 1949年，当地原农会主席因历史和作风问题被组织撤换，他在会上发布这项命令，此人当晚自尽。 死者的家人指控他私设公堂逼供威吓， 老人被"开除出革命队伍"，取消了预备党员资格，也坐了9个月班房。 后来他做了队干部，去学校教书，重新入党，去白龟山水库带工，去铁山、石漫滩等工程。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wang Hua (b.1920) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. Wang was once married to a guard of the Kuomintang and had four children, who all died of sickness when they were little. When the Liberation Army came, Wang's husband was scared to death. After Land Reform, Wang got married with her current husband and had a little girl, who was starved to death around 1958.
王花（1920年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。 王老人曾嫁给国民党军队的警卫员，生了四个孩子，但都长了几岁就生病死去。解放军来的时候，她的丈夫吓死了。土地改革之后，她嫁给了现任丈夫，生了一个小女孩，但是1958年左右饿死了。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wu Ren (b. 1941) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. In 1958, Wu did all kinds of labor in the youth team. Her father was sent to Pingdingshan to dig the reservoir. He ran back home because he could not eat enough there. He could not get food from the canteen either, so all the other family members gave him their own portions of food. The 18-years-old Wu went to the reservoir in place of her father, so that her father could work and eat at home. When she was 19, Wu got married during Spring Festival and immediately went back working on the reservoir in winter. In 1960, Wu's sister was starved for too long and died after eating some wheat. Many people died at the reservoir too.
吴任（1941年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。1958年，吴老人在青年队从事各种劳动。她的父亲被派到平顶山挖水库，由于吃不饱，偷跑回家。食堂不给父亲吃饭，一家人省下自己的食物分给他。18岁的吴任提出自己代父亲去挖水库，让父亲留在家里工作，吃食堂。19岁时，吴在春节结婚，然后继续在冬天挖水库。1960年，老人的三妹饥饿过度，吃麦粒后死了。那时候水库也饿死了很多人。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gao Jinghua (b. 1952) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. During the Famine, Gao was only 7 or 8. The food served at the canteen was like pig food. Her older sisters went to the production team's gardens to steal food. Gao's mother was working at the canteen, and Gao sneakily ate wild vegetables while washing them. She would shut her mouth tightly when cadres came. She remembers that their big pots were taken away but they hid smaller pots and the wheat they stole. Kids at that time were all tiny like dogs because of hunger. Gao got edema once, and a doctor gave her cow feces and soybeans.
高景花（1952年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。高老人饥荒的时候才七八岁，当时食堂的食物和猪饲料一样，不够吃。她的姐姐会去生产队菜园偷东西给她吃。她的母亲在食堂工作，她在洗菜时偷吃野菜，一看到干部就把嘴绷紧。 她还回忆了自己家的大锅被没收，于是他们把小锅和偷的麦子藏起来。那时候的孩子们都被饿得很瘦小，和小狗一样。高老人被饿得身子肿起来，医生给她开的药是牛屎配黄豆。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wang Gai (b. 1920) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. Wang and her sisters were all sold to be child brides. In 1958, Wang worked day and night, which made her body ache. She carried feces in the morning to gain more work points. During the Famine, Wang tried every kind of tree leaves. Date leaves were too bitter for her. Wang had 4 children with her first husband and 1 child with her second husband. All her children died before maturity. Her youngest daughter was starved at the period of communal canteens.
王改（1920年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。王老人和她的姐妹小时候都做过童养媳。1958年，老人日夜劳动，浑身酸痛。老人清早去拉粪，以换取更多工分。饥荒期间，老人吃了所有种类能吃的树叶，只不再吃太苦的枣树叶。王老人和第一个丈夫生了四个孩子，和第二个丈夫生了一个孩子，但孩子们都没长大就去世了。 老人的小女儿在食堂期间被饿死。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Shi Xiangrong (b.1928) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. During the Great Leap Forward, Shi was in her 30s. Her husband was away from home and she was sent to dig the Northern Canal until she got sick. When eating at the canteen, many people would sneakily put sweet potatoes in their own bags, but the interviewer Guo Rui's grandmother didn't dare to take any food. They ate little sweet potatoes and wheat stalks. Shi nearly died because of eating Chinese toon leaves. One son and one daughter of Shi's died within the same year. Once, 9 people died within the same day and there were barely people to dig graves for the dead.
石香荣（1928年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。大跃进期间，石老人三十多岁，丈夫出去工作，于是她被叫去挖北干渠，生病了才回家。村里吃食堂期间，大家都偷偷往袋子里放红薯，就采访人郭睿的奶奶不敢偷东西。他们当时吃红薯疙瘩、麦秸等等，石老人有次吃椿叶差点身亡。她的一个儿子和一个女儿都在那时同一年被饿死。当地有一次一天死九个人，都没有劳动力做坟墓。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chen Lian (b.1933) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. Chen's mother died early. After she grew up, she took care of her father. In both the 1942 and 1958 famine, she went soliciting food. In 1960, her grandparents competed to give their food to her and other children. Later, her grandmother gradually died of hunger. At the commune, Chen worked three shifts a day and worked extra time at the mill after it got dark. Her strained her body so that cadres would not criticize her.
陈莲（1933年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。陈老人母亲去世得早，长大后一直照顾自己父亲。陈老人在1942年和1958年的饥荒时期都出去要饭。1960年，她的外婆和外公争着把东西省下给孩子们，后来外婆慢慢被饿死了。陈老人在公社期间，一天出工三次，天黑了也要去推磨。她累得浑身是伤，不想被干部训斥。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Yan Zheni (b.1939) is a resident of Daguo Village, Daguo Xiang, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. When people ate at the eating halls, they could only have porridge like noodle soup without noodles. If the porridge was spilled, people would lie on the ground to lick it. People also had various kinds of famine foods. Every family needed to work for credits, so Yan worked in the field at night, leaving her little daughter at home. She could not come back to her except to feed her breastmilk. Dozens of people died every day and villagers did not have time to bury them. Yan's parents also died then. Yan's first husband was from a family of rich peasant, and three people died in their family. She only survived the hunger because she was later married to her second husband, a cadre. The filmmaker's description of this interview has been translated into English.

闫这妮(1939年生)是河南省漯河市临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。村民集体在食堂吃饭时，每天喝的粥和煮面条的汤水一样，但洒在地上都有人趴着舔。人们只能吃苇根、茨茭芽、豆糁儿等充饥。家家户户都得干活换工分，闫老人当时晚上去田里干活，只能把小女儿留在家中，除非喂奶不能回去。当时一天可以死几十人，来不及被埋葬，老人的父母也是那时候饿死的。她的第一任丈夫家是富农，当时死了三口人，她跟着当干部的第二任丈夫，才没有被饿死。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Guo Xueliang (b.1949) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. When people first started to eat in the eating hall，life was easy. They had enough food and got money every month. In the following two years, things got bad and people ate all kinds of famine food to survive. People in their thirties or forties had rely on walking sticks because of hunger. Guo recollects their hard work at the reservoir and their harsh supervisors. His father stole some food and killed himself by jumping into a well, for fear of being denounced, leaving behind his wife and four children. The youngest child was sent away. During the Cultural Revolution, Red Guards were treated well, and went around the country for free to communicate with each other. Guo travelled many places to denounce people.

郭学亮（1949年生）河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。1958年刚开始吃食堂的时候生活还好，食物充足，每月还会发钱，后面两年就不行了，人们吃各种东西以度过饥饿，三四十岁的人也得拄着拐杖走路。老人还回忆了当时挖水库的辛苦，和干部严厉的管教。他的父亲偷了点食物，怕被批斗，于是投井自尽，留下家里的老婆和四个孩子，最小的孩子后来被送走了。文化大革命期间，红卫兵的待遇很好，全国串联坐车吃饭都免费，他去了很多地方批斗。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Guo Jingye (b.1942) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. When people ate at the eating halls, there were not much food, because there were not enough fertilizers to yield a good harvest. The production team, to deal with their higher authorities, borrowed tables and chairs from families to fake a good eating hall. At better times, people could eat sweet potato leaves, but when things were really hard in 1959, people could only have certain kinds of famine foods. People who did not work for the production team could not have food and people would rather steal food and got beaten up. Being an accountant, Guo knew that any excess of food would be turned in to the government. Guo also recollects people working on the reservoir, who only wore scanty clothes in the winter, and that some cadres beat people there. The filmmaker's description of this interview has been translated into English.

郭景业（1942年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。郭老人回忆吃食堂的时候，国家化肥供应不上,粮食减产，人们没有东西吃。有时生产队为了应付上级检查，吃饭"桌子化"，即从各家各户搜集桌椅板凳凑到一起，等检查完了再归还各家。生活容易一些的时候，人们可以吃红薯叶等，1959年最艰苦时，只能吃苇根和扁豆糠。不去生产队干活的人就没有饭吃，人们宁愿偷吃东西然后挨打。老人当时做会计，粮食多就得交给国家。老人还回忆了人们都得在冬天穿着单衣去修水库，工地上有干部打人。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Guo Que (b.1929) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. Guo Que recalled the Famine happened in 1942 and 1958. During the Great Leap Forward in 1958, Guo and her fellow villagers had to lots of physical labors like digging farm pools and buring human feces in the fields as fertilizer at night. At the commue canteen, small amount of Sorghum flour and wild vegetables were their main food., yet they told representativres from higher-ups that they were eating steamed buns every day.
郭缺（1929年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。郭老人回忆了1942年和1958年的大饥荒。58年时，她和村民们被叫去挖坑塘，深夜挑粪等重活。村里吃食堂期间，少量的秫黍(高粱)面和野菜是主要的食物，上级检查时说整天吃蒸馍。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Guo Shuiwang (b.1927) is a resident of Daguo Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. In 1942, Guo ran away from the famine and solicited food. His father died in Biyang. A year after, he worked for a landlord and was abused till being liberated in 1947. In 1958, he worked at the mining field and was well fed. After three years, he went back to the village to be the leader of the production team, until people started to work on their own land.
郭水旺（1927年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡大郭村村民。郭老人1942年曾逃荒要饭，父亲死在泌阳。要饭一年多后，给地主家扛长工，受了虐待，1947年以后才解放。1958年，他在平顶山五矿当工人，吃得很好。三年后回村当生产队队长，一直当到分田单干。

did.unittitle: Dameng Village | 漯河市临颍县杜曲镇大孟村

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dameng Village is located in Lingying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Guo Rui.
大孟村位于河南省漯河市临颍县杜曲镇。村民的录像采访人是郭睿。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Xia Daini (b.1935) is a resident of Dameng Village, Luohe City, Henan Province. In the Spring of 1958, Xia was in confinement after giving birth to her daughter, and she was sick in bed because of hunger. Her grandmother ate some kinds of famine food. As a result, her stomach went wrong and she died in September. Xia remembers going out to solicit food after eating at the eating hall. With other companions, Xia walked lengths for food. Many still starved to death. The filmmaker's description of this interview has been translated into English.
夏代妮（1935年生）是河南省临颍县杜曲镇大孟村村民。1958年春天，夏老人坐月子期间被饿得病在床上。她的奶奶那时候，吃野菜等食物，肠胃功能紊乱，九月去世了。吃完食堂以后，老人又跑出去要饭，和同村的同伴四处奔走讨要食物。很多人那时候被饿死了。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zhang Qiuyue (b.1937) is a resident of Zhengge Village, Duqu County, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. During the famine of 1942, Zhang was only old enough to start to remember things. Her father sold clothes and bought Chinese bean pancakes back. They cut the pancakes into pieces to eat them. They relied on Zhang's uncle's help to survive. Later, Zhang's grandfather gave her some lands, and she ate food left by the Japanese people who lived there. When people ate at eating halls, Zhang cooked there and had enough food. She also brought buns to her mother from work. After people could work on their own, life became better. Zhang also recollects her family stealthily made baskets and went to sell them at night.
张秋月（1937年生）是河南省临颍县杜曲镇大孟村村民。 1942年饥荒的时候，老人刚记事，父亲出去卖衣服，买了豆饼回来砍了吃，靠舅舅家接济。后来老人的爷爷给了老人几亩地，吃日本人剩下的食物。吃食堂的时候，老人在食堂做饭，没有挨饿，给母亲带馍馍吃，单干以后生活才逐渐改善。老人还回忆了和家人在家里偷偷地编篮子，晚上背去卖。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zhang Chun'ai (b.1933) is a resident of Dameng Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. She and her mother went out to beg for food, later her father went to look for them and he died somewhere.张春爱（1933年生）回忆说她和妈妈出去要饭，她爹后来出去找她们，死在了外面。 Yu Meirong is a resident of Dameng Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. Yu is the interviewer Guo Rui's great grandmother. Yu and her husband tried to feed Yu's sister's child (Guo Rui's great uncle) at home. They gave the child their own buns and ate wild vegetables or wheat seedlings. Yu had two daughters in her 40s. Yu says that her parents and older brother were starved to death in 1942 or 1958.
于美荣居住于漯河市临颍县杜曲镇大孟村郑阁，是采访人郭睿的太姥姥。于老人说她和丈夫曾把她姐姐家的孩子（采访人郭睿的三姥爷）抱回来喂养，两人省下窝窝头给孩子吃，自己吃野菜或者麦苗。于老人四十多岁的时候才有了两个女儿。老人说自己的父母和哥哥在1942年或者1958年被饿死。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Yu Meirong is a resident of Dameng Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. Yu is the interviewer Guo Rui's great grandmother. Yu and her husband tried to feed Yu's sister's child (Guo Rui's great uncle) at home. They gave the child their own buns and ate wild vegetables or wheat seedlings. Yu had two daughters in her 40s. Yu says that her parents and older brother were starved to death in 1942 or 1958.
于美荣居住于漯河市临颍县杜曲镇大孟村郑阁，是采访人郭睿的太姥姥。于老人说她和丈夫曾把她姐姐家的孩子（采访人郭睿的三姥爷）抱回来喂养，两人省下窝窝头给孩子吃，自己吃野菜或者麦苗。于老人四十多岁的时候才有了两个女儿。老人说自己的父母和哥哥在1942年或者1958年被饿死。

did.unittitle: Hezhuang Village | 漯河市临颍县大郭乡何庄村

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hezhuang Village is located in Lingying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Guo Rui.
何庄村位于河南省漯河市临颍县大郭乡。村民的录像采访人是郭睿。

did.unittitle: He Maigui and Wu Peng | 何麦贵&吴捧

dao.xlink:title: Interview with He Maigui and Wu Peng

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: He Maigui (b.1928) is a resident of Daguo Village, Daguo Xiang, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. During the famine of 1942, He's sister was forced to marry to someone far away from home, so that her family could get a basket of food in return. In 1958, all the cookware was confiscated and families were not allowed to cook at home. People ate at the eating hall, where noodle soups did not have noodles. Many people starved to death. Unwilling to take orders, He refused to take the good job of cooking in the eating hall, but was still assigned the job of cooking when he went to work at the river. Workers at the river worked nonstop with day and night shifts. People worked hard there for steamed buns. Wu Peng (b.1930), wife of He Maigui. The filmmaker's description of this interview has been translated into English.
何麦贵（1928年生）是河南省临颍县大郭乡何庄村村民。1942年饥荒，何老人的妹妹被远嫁他乡，只为换一篮粮食给家人吃。1958年，家家户户的锅都被没收，不准开伙，只能吃食堂给的食物，面条里都没有面，很多人饿死。他因为不喜欢听人指挥，拒绝了去食堂当伙夫的美差，不想去挖河还是被分配了伙夫的功夫。挖河的人昼夜不停，两班倒，但有因为白面馍吃，人们都拼命干活。吴捧（1930年生）, 何麦贵妻子.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: He Zishen (b.1953) is a resident of Hezhuang Village, Daguo Xiang, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. He recalls that villagers were not allowed to cook at home. Those who did were critized at struggle sessions. Village canteen only supplied thin soup with a few small chucks of yam. Adults tried save the yam for their childre. People ate all sorts of tree leaves, even tree bark. He said that the famine was caused because village cadres had to greatly exaggerate the production. There were a lot of struggle sessions in the villages.
何自申（1953年生）回忆说59年和60年最困难。村民不允许在各自家里开火，开小锅的会被批斗。食堂只有稀汤，里面有几块红薯。大人还尽量省下给孩子们吃。人们吃各种的树叶，连树皮都吃掉了。饥饿是因为干部们虚报产量。村里常开各种批斗会。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wang Guizhi (b. 1954) is a resident of Hezhuang Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. She said that she was little when the famine happened. Children in the village were so starved that they just sat there all day. Her grandfather died of starvation. People were not allowed to cook at home. Those who can walk long distance all went to Shaanxi Province to beg for food.
王贵枝（1954年生）回忆饥荒时说那时候小孩子们饿得跑不动，整天坐在家里。她的爷爷饿死了。各家不许做饭。村里走得动的都去陕西逃荒要饭了。

did.unittitle: Poyang Village | 漯河市临颍县大郭乡坡杨村

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Poyang Village is located in Lingying County, Luohe City, Henan Province. Interviews in this sub-series were conducted and filmed by Guo Rui.
坡杨村位于河南省漯河市临颍县大郭乡。村民的录像采访人是郭睿。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wang Qin (b.1920) is a resident of Poyang Village, Linying County, Luohe City, Henan Province.During the Land Reform Movement, Wang's family was classified as rich peasant. She suffered through eating at eating halls and Cultural Revolution, but could not remember their details due to her age.
